title: HTML Elements: Block vs Inline
description: Understanding the fundamental difference between container (block) and inline elements

lessons.title: Block vs Inline Elements
lessons.description:
HTML elements fall into two main categories:

Block elements (containers) start on a new line and take full width. Examples: <div>, <p>, <h1>, <section>

Inline elements flow within text and only take needed width. Examples: <span>, <a>, <strong>, <em>
lessons.task: Wrap the word <kbd>important</kbd> with <kbd><strong></kbd> tags to make it bold. Notice how the paragraph (block) takes full width while strong (inline) flows with text.
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui, sans-serif; padding: 20px; } p { background: #e3f2fd; padding: 10px; } strong { background: #ffecb3; }

lessons.title: Semantic Container Elements
lessons.description:
Modern HTML uses semantic containers that describe their content:

<header> - Page or section header
<nav> - Navigation links
<main> - Main content area
<section> - Thematic grouping
<article> - Self-contained content
<footer> - Page or section footer
lessons.task: Create a basic page structure with <kbd><header></kbd>, <kbd><main></kbd>, and <kbd><footer></kbd> elements. Add a heading in the header.
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui; margin: 0; } header { background: #1976d2; color: white; padding: 15px; } main { padding: 20px; min-height: 100px; } footer { background: #424242; color: white; padding: 10px; text-align: center; }

validations.message: Add an <h1> heading inside your header

lessons.title: Generic Containers: div and span
lessons.description:
When you need a container without semantic meaning:

<div> - Generic block container (for layout/grouping)
<span> - Generic inline container (for styling text portions)

Use semantic elements when possible, div/span when no semantic element fits.
lessons.task: Wrap the word 'highlighted' in a <kbd><span></kbd> to style it differently. Wrap the whole quote in a <kbd><div></kbd>.
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: Georgia, serif; padding: 20px; } div { background: #f5f5f5; padding: 15px; border-left: 4px solid #1976d2; } span { background: #fff59d; padding: 2px 4px; }
